title: Curecanti National Recreation Area: Lake Fork
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping     Camping     Lake Fork                Lake Fork Campground              Lake Fork Campground is located 27 miles west of Gunnison on CO Highway 92 near the intersection with U.S. Highway 50 on the shore of Blue Mesa Reservoir. All types of camping from tents to large RVs can be accommodated at Lake Fork. The campground is paved except for the tent walk-in sites. First-come first-served sites can usually be found except on summer holiday weekends.    Approximate Open Dates: April to mid-October   Sites: 90   Accessible Sites: yes    Water:  yes, mid-May to mid-September    Flush Toilets:  yes, mid-May to mid-September     Vault Toilets:  yes    Electric Hookups:  no   Dump Station:  yes    Showers:  yes, mid-May to mid-September    Tables & Fire Grates:  yes    Visitor Center:  no    Ranger Programs:  no    Marina:  yes, mid-May to early September   Restaurant:  no   Boat Ramp:  yes    Fish Cleaning Station:  yes, mid-May to mid-September    Elevation:  7580 feet            Reservation Information Reservations can be made for sites in the upper and middle sections. Reservations must be made at least 3 days in advance. All reservable sites have a maximum 14 consecutive day stay in a 30 day period.  Lake Fork Campground Map (pdf) »      Fees     Lower Section (first-come first-served)  $16.00 per night ($8.00 per night with Interagency Senior/Access Pass)    Upper & Middle Sections  $16.00 per night, plus $3.00 if reserved ($8.00 per night with Interagency Senior/Access Pass, plus $3.00 per night if reserved)
